snippet: As technology exposes more sunken booty to commercial explorers, they are facing resistance and counterclaims by governments, the United Nations and marine archaeologists.
abstract: Unesco, United Nations agency charged with protecting cultural treasures around world, United States Homeland Security Dept, Panamanian government and commercial treasure hunters are all engaged in battle over artifacts from sunken Spanish galleon in Gulf of Panama; at issue is issue of whether private maritime salvage enterprises should be allowed to claim and profit from historic objects and riches.
lead_paragraph: As technology exposes more sunken booty to commercial explorers, they are facing resistance and counterclaims by governments, the United Nations and marine archaeologists.

headline.main: With Shipwreck Treasure Easier to Reach, a Duel Is On
headline.print_headline: With More Sunken Riches to Grab, a Duel Is On

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization
